title: Compiler hangs at ObligationForest

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: I-hang
labels.description: Issue: The compiler never terminates, due to infinite loops, deadlock, livelock, etc.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried something like the code below:

[playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=2f6e4deaa95c0384060513f996786fe0)
```rust
struct Wrapper<T>(T);

struct Test;

pub unsafe trait Foo: Sized {
    type Bar: Bar<Self>;
}

pub unsafe trait Bar<B: Foo>: Sized {}

unsafe impl<S: Bar<Self>> Foo for Wrapper<&mut S> {
    type Bar = S;
}

unsafe impl<B: Foo<Bar = Self>> Bar<B> for Test {}

fn assert<B: Foo>(b: B) {}

fn test() {
    assert(Wrapper(&mut Test))
}
```

I thought this should compile, because everything checks out, but instead I got the compiler to go into an infinite loop! It *never* stops (I had one instance run for over 10 minutes, with no end in sight)
